headline: Murders Creep Up in New York, but Crime Numbers Show Complex Trends
abstract: Murders rose in 2019 for the first time in three years, yet they are still extremely low compared with past eras, and reports of other violent crimes crept up only slightly or declined.
lead_paragraph: For the last several years, New York City officials have proudly claimed the title of the safest big city in the country. But for the first time in years, the crime figures for the last 12 months are threatening to undermine that sense of safety.
